author: cheerful_piglet_95568
content:
Hi Folks, We are trying to spin up a ropsten cluster in preparation for June 8th. We have an existing kiln cluster that uses the below peers

    --bootnodes "enode://c354db99124f0faf677ff0e75c3cbbd568b2febc186af664e0c51ac435609badedc67a18a63adb64dacc1780a28dcefebfc29b83fd1a3f4aa3c0eb161364cf94@164.92.130.5:30303"

Would someone be able to advice what we should be using for geth peers in ropsten? Currently when we use this list for ropsten, geth is complaining that it is not able to find any peers. (errors below)

WARN [06-02|00:40:28.058] Snapshot extension registration failed   peer=35f2159c err="peer connected on snap without compatible eth support"
INFO [06-02|00:40:30.357] Looking for peers                        peercount=0 tried=191 static=0

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: The ropsten bootnodes are baked into the client. You don't need to specify anything for ropsten

author: cheerful_piglet_95568
content:
Thank you ! I left the bootnode empty this time and when I start, It hasnt complained about the peers so far. However, I see the below message being thrown out constantly

WARN [06-02|14:08:13.246] Served eth_chainId                       conn=172.19.0.4:33376 reqid=1 duration="20.715µs" err="chain not synced beyond EIP-155 replay-protection fork block"

and lighthouse is showing the below error. I am assuming the below error is because the geth client is not fully up?

Jun 02 14:09:13.247 CRIT Could not connect to a suitable eth1 node. Please ensure that you have an eth1 http server running locally on http://localhost:8545 or specify one or more (remote) endpoints using `--eth1-endpoints <COMMA-SEPARATED-SERVER-ADDRESSES>`. Also ensure that `eth` and `net` apis are enabled on the eth1 http server, warning: BLOCK PROPOSALS WILL FAIL WITHOUT VALID, SYNCED ETH1 CONNECTION, service: eth1_rpc

author: dapplion
content:
Raised this question in latest consensus call, pasting here too:

To be merged testnets from an existing beacon chain have dual names. For mainnet is easy because there's mainnet beacon chain, and mainnet "eth1". Ropsten's beacon chain doesn't appear to have any explicit name. But for Goerli, there's two names: Prater and Goerli. Will some name take over? Or it will be a dual named merged testnet

author: m.kalinin
content: I think previously there was a suggestion to make alias of one to another (Prater to Goerly aliased on CL side). And the name should remain Goerli post Merge.

author: jgm
content: Yeah it's a special case for goerli as it's the only one going to be merged with an existing consensus chain.  Using goerli as the known name for the combined chain is sensible, and we can either rename prater internally or just leave it as an anomaly.

author: .paulharris
content: Hey all, we've got a teku issue around removing `INVALID_TERMINAL_BLOCK`, just wondering if geth or besu have `INVALID_TERMINAL_BLOCK` still in use, or if we're good to clean that up now?
